name: Hilton Omaha

reviews.text: I am not trully impressed with this hotel, they nickel and dime you for everything...I am used to paying for internet, so that I don't mind (though it was very slow), but paying $10 dollars to use the pool, and $10 dollars to use the gym?? I had never heard such a thing...prices for printing and copying are outrages, and they don't even have a real "gift shop", it was more of a corner with a few things....When they serviced my room, they didn't even replace my used bottles of shampoo, conditioner and mouthwash with new ones...had to call the front desk to actually get some new ones. Used the coffee maker in my room, and they didn't restock, even though I asked.
reviews.title: Not very good experience...

reviews.text: Overall my experience was NOT a good one, and I will NOT come back to this hotel
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, clean, quiet and well appointed

reviews.text: This hotel is located downtown across from the convention center. The rooms are very nice, well appointed. It is clean and quiet. A good value.
reviews.title: nothing too exciting. mostly an average stay, other that the 10.00 day internet service! :(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price the charge you for room & food, you'd think the internet would be free. Very disappointing.
reviews.title: Hilton Hotel in Omaha is the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton Hotel across from the Qwest Center in Omaha, NE is the best place to stay!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location. Where the celebrities stay!

reviews.text: From the moment the shuttle picked me up at Eppley Field I had nothing but excellent experiences. I arrived at 11:00 am, yet an upgraded Executive Floor room was ready and waiting due to HHonors Gold status, and on departure day, a late checkout was as easy as a simple request.
reviews.title: An Upscale Hilton Where Hospitality Shines

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Executive Floor Lounge was recently renovated, and unlike some Hiltons, it is open all day, even on weekends. This property does not offer complimentary alcohol, but the breakfast is of very good quality, the ladies in the lounge are very gracious, and snacks and beverages are available throughout the day. In the evening, the hors d'ouvres were jumbo shrimp and ravioli and sufficient for a light dinner and I understand they do vary the evening offerings across the week. 3 computers with internet service are also available on a complimentary basis in the lounge.
reviews.title: It's going to co$t you

reviews.text: I considered the room to be large and the furnishings of a higher quality than many Hiltons. The room was absolutely immaculate and while some reviewers mention wear in the rooms, I only noticed a bit of wear in the pile of the carpet, but otherwise nothing else.
reviews.title: A great business and pleasure hotel in Omaha.

reviews.text: My understanding is that the entire hotel will be renovated and expanded soon, and I salute properties that renovate before rooms get long in the tooth, because that isn't a given in today's economy.
reviews.title: Great service, but not clean!!

reviews.text: Though I received complimentary Executive Floor, it was only $35 additional on the dates I was there, which makes it a bargain for the enhanced service, food offerings, and beverages and bottled waters across the day.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel, Great Service but...

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton Omaha for the CWS and was extremely impressed by the level of service and friendliness of every single employee I came in contact with. Omaha is an extremely special place to be during the CWS and the employees of the Hilton are what help make this experience so special. In addition to the very friendly employees, this is a great Hilton. Yes, rooms are starting to see some slight evidence of wear and tear (nothing out of the ordinary for a convention hotel that gets a lot of use), but management has noticed it before it has become an issue and a renovation is scheduled. Rooms are very clean and housekeeping is very quick with special requests (extra towels, making a second trip up to freshen a room in the evening, etc.). I highly recommend the Hilton to anyone planning a trip to Omaha and I will definitely be staying there again when my business travels have me return.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at a few Hilton hotels on vacation and have stayed in many hotels in the Omaha area on our yearly trips to the Omaha Zoo. Hilton Omaha was above average for the area in quality. Room price was much higher then other quality hotels in the area. When you add the $9.00 a day self parking and $10 a day internet access, the daily rate is quite high when compared to other similar hotels. The bed was very comfortable. Bathtub had a large rust stain and a few of the shower head sprays pointed in awkward directions due to lime/grit buildup. Rooms were quiet for the most part, but you could hear it quite clearly when anyone else shut their room doors. Rooms were larger then average, with plenty of room for a large desk and a comfortable chair/ottoman. Room was decorated very nicely. 32 inch flat screen TV's had a great picture. Room service was fast and very polite. Food was good and the room service pizza was actual a good value. Front desk staff were fast and friendly. The location was very convenient to shopping and it is located at the Qwest Center. We did not use the fitness center or pool.
reviews.title: Good quality hotel, but higher priced then similar hotels.

reviews.text: Overall, if you are on a budget, you can get a similar quality hotel room for much less at other locations. If you are in town for anything at the Qwest Center, it would be worth paying the extra money for the convenience. Order the room service pizza, it's good and price is better then other delivery restaurants nearby. If you want quiet, ask for a room at the end of the hall.
reviews.title: Good service, nice amenities & location but NOISY

reviews.text: This is a great hotel in so many ways but I wouldn't stay again because of the noise in the hallways throughout the night and between rooms.
reviews.title: Very convenient to Qwest

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: A great option in Omaha

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a room at the downtown Hilton so we would be near the Qwest center for the George Strait concert. The location was perfect and it was nice to be able to use the valet parking, check in and then just relax until it was time to head to the show.
reviews.title: Not pleasant

reviews.text: I found the hotel lobby to be very nice in that there were plenty of places to sit and relax near the lobby bar. The room was quiet and good for sleeping. The breakfast buffet was delicious and the wait person there was top-notch.
reviews.title: I would NOT choose to stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now the down side. Upon making reservations I called the hotel to verify that the package I had selected did include the price for valet parking (Rest Assured Package) and I was told yes. I did not ask for her name because I had no idea that I would later have to defend myself against an employee that had not been properly trained by Hilton.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We had been told that valet parking was included, but when I went t the check-in desk to check in--I was told that the package did NOT include the price for valet parking. Hmmmmm..........even though it was Hilton's fault that I was misinformed, they had planned to charge me for the difference. I protested and complained, but the desk clerk was very short and said "Call 1-800-HILTONS."
reviews.title: Will not stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So I did. They were very gracious and shortly thereafter I was contacted by the local Hilton hotel manager. She took care of the matter without delay.
reviews.title: Great stay - we'll be back!

description: Hilton Omaha offers prime location with 600 Guestrooms (150 new and 450 newly remodeled), fresh, new lobby design and Hilton Omaha is surrounded by CenturyLink Cener Omaha, Lewis & Clark Landing at the Missouri River, TD Ameritrade Park and North Downtown Omaha, the Hilton Omaha puts you steps from the Civic Center, Holland Performing Art Center and historic Old Market with its world famous shopping, dining and entertainment. Omaha has evolved into a world-class meetings and leisure destination - alive with energy and spirit and now Hilton Omaha is taking the lead with a complete renewal and expansion to enhance our hotel in downtown Omaha.
